courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Introduction to Programming
courses.description: This course will introduce heros to programming. It will introduce the building blocks of programming languages (variables, decisions, calculations, loops, array, and input/output) and use them to solve problems.

courses.subject: WDD
courses.title: Web Fundamentals
courses.description: This course introduces heros to the World Wide Web and to careers in web site design and development. The course is hands on with heros actually participating in simple web designs and programming. It is anticipated that heros who complete this course will understand the fields of web design and development and will have a good idea if they want to pursue this degree as a major.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Programming with Functions
courses.description: CSE 111 heros become more organized, efficient, and powerful computer programmers by learning to research and call functions written by others; to write, call, debug, and test their own functions; and to handle errors within functions. CSE 111 heros write programs with functions to solve problems in many disciplines, including business, physical science, human performance, and humanities.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Programming with Classes
courses.description: This course will introduce the notion of classes and objects. It will present encapsulation at a conceptual level. It will also work with inheritance and polymorphism.

courses.subject: WDD
courses.title: Dynamic Web Fundamentals
courses.description: This course builds on prior experience in Web Fundamentals and programming. heros will learn to create dynamic websites that use JavaScript to respond to events, update content, and create responsive user experiences.

courses.subject: WDD
courses.title: Frontend Web Development I
courses.description: This course builds on prior experience with Dynamic Web Fundamentals and programming. heros will focus on user experience, accessibility, compliance, performance optimization, and basic API usage.

courses.subject: GS
courses.title: Career Development
courses.description: In this course, students develop resources, professional connections, and essential employability skills to obtain or improve employment in a field related to their university certificate. Students will network and apply for job opportunities in their industry, and lifeâ€‘long skills are gained that will help both active and future job seekers.

courses.subject: CIT
courses.title: Introduction to Databases
courses.description: Introductory course covering basic database concepts and SQL.

courses.subject: WDD
courses.title: Web Frontend Development II
courses.description: Advanced frontend development with responsive design and JavaScript frameworks.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Web Backend Development
courses.description: Server-side programming, APIs, and database integration.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Web Services
courses.description: RESTful web services and integration with frontend applications.

courses.subject: WDD
courses.title: Web Full-Stack Development
courses.description: Combines frontend and backend skills to build full-stack web applications.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Programming with Data Structures
courses.description: Introduction to data structures and algorithms.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Software Testing
courses.description: Covers software testing concepts, methodologies, and tools.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Applied Programming
courses.description: Practical programming projects applying advanced programming techniques.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: .NET Software Development
courses.description: .NET framework and software development best practices.

courses.subject: CSE
courses.title: Architectural Design
courses.description: Software architecture principles and design patterns.
